Transforming the World of Electronic Systems with Cadence.AI
Differentiate, optimize, and accelerate your product roadmap
What's New
What We Can Do for You
Your design challenges involve much more than a point-tool. Explore our comprehensive solutions and methodologies.
Learn what engineers achieve when they design with Cadence

Overview
Cadence is a pivotal leader in electronic systems design, building upon more than 30 years of computational software expertise. The company applies its underlying Intelligent System Design strategy to deliver software, hardware, and IP that turn design concepts into reality.
Cadence customers are the world’s most innovative companies, delivering extraordinary products from chips to systems, chemicals to drugs, and specification to manufacturing for the most dynamic market applications, including hyperscale computing, 5G communications, automotive, mobile, aerospace, consumer, industrial, and life sciences.
We pride ourselves on creating and sustaining a company culture that drives innovation and business success. Cadence is recognized as a Great Place to Work around the world, including as one of the Fortune “100 Best Companies to Work For” for the last 10 years.
We Offer Solutions For
Semiconductor, system and drug design companies, offering the broadest, most integrated end-to-end solution to help today’s electronic designers do their best work creating tomorrow’s products.
Investor Relations
The Cadence Investor Resource Center is available for investors, prospective shareholders, and those simply interested in learning more about the company. Here you will find information regarding Cadence’s global presence, business drivers, customer successes, business model, and more.
Learn More

Overview
The Next Evolution in Principled Simulation and AI-Powered Innovations
By combining NVIDIA-based GPU technology with a comprehensive suite of Cadence’s computational software and AI, the Cadence Millennium M2000 Supercomputer enables a shift-left of in-design analysis through high-fidelity simulation and massive acceleration of the design, analysis, and optimization process. Spanning applications from chip design and data centers to automotive, aircraft engineering, and drug discovery, this next-generation platform will be critical to transforming AI-driven silicon, systems, and drug design.
Key Benefits
Accelerating Silicon, Systems, and Drug Design
GPU Acceleration
Cadence’s best-in-class solvers integrate with NVIDIA Blackwell accelerated compute to deliver unmatched scale and speed
Greater Productivity
GPU acceleration delivers same-day decision-making with up to 80X faster turnaround time (TAT) and up to 20X lower power
Optimized Performance
Scalable, high-performance computing (HPC) architecture and modern GPU resident solvers are tuned for optimal system performance
Multiphysics Analysis
Comprehensive multiphysics analysis for digital twin accuracy of entire systems
Turnkey Solution
Comprehensive, ready-to-go supercomputing solution available on-premises or on cloud
Highly Scalable
Stackable compute nodes scale with the application for the fastest turnaround time
Applications
Optimized for a Broad Range of Workloads
The Millennium M2000 Supercomputer harnesses Cadence’s broad array of EDA, system design analysis, and molecular solvers to perform massive simulations that were previously impossible, transforming approaches to semiconductor and 3D-IC design, data center digital twins, drug discovery modeling, and other engineering challenges across the hyperscale computing, automotive, data center, and aerospace and defense markets.
System Design and Analysis
The Millennium M2000 Supercomputer enhances system design analysis (SDA) with capabilities that extend 3D-IC system packaging, aerospace and defense applications, and autonomous vehicle engineering.
As electronic and mechatronic systems grow in complexity, traditional multiphysics analysis can lead to prolonged simulation times extending days or weeks, delaying critical decision-making. The Millennium platform enables faster turnaround times and supports in-design analysis, resulting in more informed decisions and optimized designs.
Electronic Design Automation
For electronic design automation (EDA), the Millennium M2000 Supercomputer’s powerful GPU acceleration integrates seamlessly with Cadence’s Voltus IC Power Integrity Solution and Spectre X Simulator.
The Voltus solution utilizes the Millenium GPU hardware and GPU-optimized solver to achieve over 20X improvement in runtime. The solver is scalable with lower memory requirements and enhanced fault tolerance, resulting in significantly shorter simulation times and enabling previously impossible simulations.
Drug Discovery Automation
Cadence Molecular Sciences accelerates drug discovery by enabling pharmaceutical customers to perform more simulations in less time with Millennium CPU and GPU resources. Cadence’s Orion® Molecular Design Platform uses the Millennium M2000 Supercomputer on Cadence Cloud to equip researchers with unmatched computational power to speed up the discovery of potential drug candidates and enhance process scalability. As a result, customers can explore more design scenarios and iterations within tighter deadlines, leading to faster innovation and improved product development.
